words.definition: existing in large quantities; plentiful
words.example_sentence: The garden had an _____ supply of fresh vegetables.

words.definition: careful to avoid potential problems or dangers
words.example_sentence: She was _____ when crossing the busy street.

words.definition: eager to know or learn something
words.example_sentence: The _____ child asked many questions about the stars.

words.definition: easily broken or damaged; fragile
words.example_sentence: Handle the _____ china cups with care.

words.definition: wanting to do something very much
words.example_sentence: The students were _____ to start their field trip.

words.definition: easily broken, damaged, or destroyed
words.example_sentence: The _____ glass vase needed special protection.

words.definition: willing to give more than necessary or expected
words.example_sentence: My _____ neighbor shared cookies with everyone.

words.definition: dark or poorly lit; sad and depressing
words.example_sentence: The _____ weather made everyone feel sleepy.

words.definition: having a modest view of one's own importance
words.example_sentence: Despite winning the award, she remained _____.

words.definition: unable to be seen; not visible
words.example_sentence: The tiny germs are _____ to the naked eye.

words.definition: feeling or expressing great happiness
words.example_sentence: The children were _____ on their birthday.

words.definition: giving firm and constant support or allegiance
words.example_sentence: A _____ friend stays by your side through hard times.

words.definition: difficult to understand or explain; strange
words.example_sentence: The _____ footprints led into the forest.

words.definition: easily worried or anxious; uneasy
words.example_sentence: I felt _____ before giving my presentation.

words.definition: easily seen or understood; clear
words.example_sentence: It was _____ that she had been practicing hard.

words.definition: free from disturbance; calm and quiet
words.example_sentence: The _____ lake was perfect for an afternoon nap.

words.definition: of great value; not to be wasted
words.example_sentence: The family photo album was _____ to her.

words.definition: making little or no noise; peaceful
words.example_sentence: Please be _____ in the library.

words.definition: happening in a short time; fast
words.example_sentence: The _____ river current carried the boat downstream.

words.definition: strong and solid; well-built
words.example_sentence: The _____ table could hold many heavy books.

words.definition: showing consideration for the needs of others
words.example_sentence: It was _____ of you to bring me soup when I was sick.

words.definition: belonging to the very distant past; very old
words.example_sentence: The _____ ruins were built thousands of years ago.

words.definition: showing courage and willingness to take risks
words.example_sentence: The _____ explorer ventured into unknown lands.

words.definition: quick to understand and learn; intelligent
words.example_sentence: The _____ student solved the puzzle quickly.

words.definition: far away in space or time
words.example_sentence: We could see the _____ mountains on the horizon.

words.definition: graceful and stylish in appearance or manner
words.example_sentence: The dancer's movements were smooth and _____.

words.definition: having a violent or aggressive nature
words.example_sentence: The _____ tiger protected its cubs.

words.definition: kind, mild, and calm in manner or behavior
words.example_sentence: The _____ breeze felt nice on a warm day.

words.definition: unpleasantly rough or severe
words.example_sentence: The _____ winter wind stung our faces.

words.definition: extremely large or great in size or degree
words.example_sentence: The _____ whale was bigger than our boat.

words.definition: having a sharp edge or point; very interested
words.example_sentence: She had a _____ interest in learning about science.

words.definition: full of life and energy; active and outgoing
words.example_sentence: The _____ music made everyone want to dance.

words.definition: unassuming in the estimation of one's abilities
words.example_sentence: Despite his success, he remained _____ about his achievements.

words.definition: quick and light in movement; agile
words.example_sentence: The _____ cat jumped from branch to branch.

words.definition: with no special or distinctive features; normal
words.example_sentence: It was just an _____ day at school.

words.definition: able to wait calmly without complaining
words.example_sentence: Be _____ and wait your turn in line.

words.definition: moving fast or doing something in a short time
words.example_sentence: She gave a _____ answer to the easy question.

words.definition: having an uneven or irregular surface; not smooth
words.example_sentence: The _____ bark of the tree scratched my hand.

words.definition: free from pretense or deceit; genuine
words.example_sentence: Her _____ apology showed she truly felt sorry.

words.definition: showing a lack of courage or confidence; shy
words.example_sentence: The _____ rabbit hid when it heard a noise.

words.definition: being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else
words.example_sentence: Each snowflake has a _____ pattern.

words.definition: of very great extent or quantity; immense
words.example_sentence: The _____ desert stretched for miles in every direction.

words.definition: feeling or showing tiredness; exhausted
words.example_sentence: After the long hike, we felt _____.

words.definition: having or showing experience, knowledge, and good judgment
words.example_sentence: The _____ old owl gave good advice.

words.definition: having lived or existed for only a short time
words.example_sentence: The _____ puppy loved to play all day.

words.definition: having or showing great energy and enthusiasm
words.example_sentence: The _____ volunteer worked tirelessly to help others.
